hanzi-su-wiki:
躍

Значения

Прыгать, скакать

Мнемоника

Прыгать 足, как фазан, птица 隹 с красивыми перьями 彐彐.

Варианты

跃
purpleculture_pinyin:
yuè
to jump; to leap
прыгать; прыгать
rtega_mnemonic:
躍躍RS
跃跃		skip, jump, frolic, dance
  • step ⻊ like a pheasant 翟
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 跃)
Pictophonetic: 翟 indicates the sound; 足 (foot) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 躍進 [ yuè jìn ]: to leap forward; to make rapid progress; a leap forward
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 足 [ zú ] foot; to attain, to satisfy; enough
    • 翟 [ dí ] long-tailed pheasant; plume; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: You use your legs to leap off the roof thinking it would be fun to land on that futon down below.
heisig_constituent: leap, wooden leg, mouth, stop, footprint, futon, feathers, wings, turkey
koohiiStory1: Well, there are weekdays weekday (#576) and there are laundry days laundry (#577), and on February 29th leap day, the manufacturer recommends servicing or replacing your peg leg because they tend to wear out every 4 years.
koohiiStory2: [Story for people following katsuo in making feathers+turkey a ´futon´ primitive] If you´re going to leap from a high place, better hope there´s a futon below -- otherwise you´re going to break your leg at the very least...
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You use your foot to kick Wolverine in the face so a turkey can leap to freedom. This turkey is trying to escape from Wolverine by leaping over a fence. Wolverine doesn’t want the turkey to escape, but you kick him with your foot and the turkey is then free to leap to safety.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine kicking Wolverine in the head with your foot as the turkey makes turkey sounds in the background. He’s taller than you so you must leap as you kick.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After you kick Wolverine and the turkey is safe, you leap onto a yak (やく) to make your getaway. This yak is really fast so you’ll have no problem outrunning Wolverine while riding it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Leap! Leap onto the yak. Feel the yak fur beneath you as you ride away to safety, wind in your hair.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 踊 (おどる、ヨウ танец, пляска).
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), ヨ, 足 (нога), 隹 (старая птица)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the little bird gives two yos (翟) as he uses his foot (⻊) to dance
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Pirates take a leap of faith in any situation which is why they have a wooden leg and die young.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " foot " to " Zhai ", it means rapid disease. "Said Wen": "Xun Ye. From the feet, Zhai Sheng." Tang Hanyu "Ping Huai West Stele": "Take everything you have, gather to prevent me, the western teacher jumps in, there is no one who stays."

" Yue " often means jumping. "Xunzi ‧ Encouraging Learning": "A Qiji jump can not take ten steps; a horse can drive ten times, and it is hard to lose.

" Yue " also means promotion. "Wen Xuan-Zuo Si "Wei Du Fu"": "Jie Zhou attacked heavily, struck the flag and jumped the stem." Liu Liang's note: "Yue, lift; stem, flag pole."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " foot " to " Zhai ", it means rapid disease.
humanum_full_description:
從「足」，「翟」聲，表示迅疾。《說文》：「迅也。从足，翟聲。」唐韓愈〈平淮西碑〉：「盡抽其有，聚以防我，西師躍入，道無留者。」

　　「躍」常表示跳躍。《荀子‧勸學》：「騏驥一躍，不能十步；駑馬十駕，功在不舍。」

　　「躍」也表示上舉。《文選‧左思〈魏都賦〉》：「介胄重襲，旍旗躍莖。」劉良注：「躍，舉也；莖，旗竿也。」

從「 足 」，「 翟 」聲，表示迅疾。《說文》：「迅也。从足，翟聲。」唐韓愈〈平淮西碑〉：「盡抽其有，聚以防我，西師躍入，道無留者。」 「 躍 」常表示跳躍。《荀子‧勸學》：「騏驥一躍，不能十步；駑馬十駕，功在不舍。」 「 躍 」也表示上舉。《文選‧左思〈魏都賦〉》：「介胄重襲，旍旗躍莖。」劉良注：「躍，舉也；莖，旗竿也。」
From the sound of " foot" to " Zhai", it means rapid disease. "Said Wen": "Xun Ye. From the feet, Zhai Sheng." Tang Hanyu "Ping Huai West Stele": "Take everything you have, gather to prevent me, the western teacher jumps in, there is no one who stays." " Yue" often means jumping. "Xunzi ‧ Encouraging Learning": "A Qiji jump can not take ten steps; a horse can drive ten times, and it is hard to lose. " Yue" also means promotion. "Wen Xuan-Zuo Si "Wei Du Fu"": "Jie Zhou attacked heavily, struck the flag and jumped the stem." Liu Liang's note: "Yue, lift; stem, flag pole."

躍字的基本解释

躍
yuè
见“跃”。

躍字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yuè］
［《廣韻》以灼切，入藥，以。］
“跃1”的繁体字。亦作“趯2”。亦作“1”。
(1)跳跃。
(2)迅疾貌。
(3)引申为迅速赶上。
(4)心动貌。
(5)上竖；上举。
(6)物价上涨。参见“騰躍”。
[②]［tì］
［《字彙》他歷切］
见“躍2躍”。

躍字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　躍； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页1235第26
【廣韻】以灼切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】弋灼切，?音藥。【說文】迅也。【博雅】上也，進也。【六書故】大爲躍，小爲踊。躍去其所，踊不離其所。【玉篇】跳躍也。【易·乾卦】或躍在淵。【詩·邶風】踊躍用兵。又【大雅】魚躍于淵。【左傳·僖二十八年】距躍三百。【註】距躍，超越也。【疏】躍以疾生名，故以距躍爲超越。　又【詩·小雅】躍躍毚兔。【音義】他歷反。【疏】跳疾也。【爾雅·釋訓】躍躍，迅也。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Unitary Collection】【Foot Character Department】　yue; Kangxi Strokes: 21; Page Number: Page 1235 Page 26
[Guang Yun] Cut with burning [Ji Yun] [Rhyme] [Zheng Yun] Yi Zhuo cut, with sound medicine. [Said the text] Xun also. [Bo Ya] Shang Ye, Jin Ye. [Six Books] Great leaps, but small enthusiasm. Leap to its place, stay in its place. [Jade articles] Jump also. [Yi·Qian Gua] Or leap in the Yuan. [Poetry·Bei Feng] Actively use soldiers. And [Daya] fish leaped into the abyss. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Twenty-Eight Years] The distance jumped three hundred. [Note] Distance jump, transcendence also. 【Sparse】Yue is the name of sickness, so distance jump is transcendence.　[Poetry·Xiaoya] Jumping over the rabbit. [Pronunciation] He has reversed history. [Sparse] Jumping disease also. [Erya·Shixun] Yueyue, Xunye.

yuè
вм. 跃
Radicals: 足, ヨ, 隹  (foot, wolverine, turkey)
Meaning Mnemonic
You use your foot to kick Wolverine in the face so a turkey can leap to freedom. This turkey is trying to escape from Wolverine by leaping over a fence. Wolverine doesn’t want the turkey to escape, but you kick him with your foot and the turkey is then free to leap to safety.
Imagine kicking Wolverine in the head with your foot as the turkey makes turkey sounds in the background. He’s taller than you so you must leap as you kick.
Reading Mnemonic
After you kick Wolverine and the turkey is safe, you leap onto a yak (やく) to make your getaway. This yak is really fast so you’ll have no problem outrunning Wolverine while riding it.
Leap! Leap onto the yak. Feel the yak fur beneath you as you ride away to safety, wind in your hair.
